title: Latest ET Manufacturing | Latest Manufacturing News : ETManufacturing.in

items.title: India’s manufacturing PMI slips to 38-month low in December
items.summary:
- PMI fell to 55.0 in December 2025 from 56.6, a 38‑month low, but stays above 50 and signals expansion.
- Growth momentum cooled as new orders and output slowed; employment rose at the slowest pace in 22 months.
- External demand softened with export orders at a 14‑month low; input costs rose while inflation remained below the long-run average.

items.title: Solar exports rise 65% in Q3; put Gujarat makers in forefront
items.summary:
- India’s solar cell/module exports rose ~65% YoY in Q3 2025 to $344.5 million, led by Gujarat-based exporters.
- Gujarat accounts for ~47% of module capacity and ~49% of cell capacity, with majors such as Adani Solar, Waaree Energies, Goldi Solar and ReNew Sys.
- Tariffs on US imports rose to 50%, margins are under pressure, but rupee depreciation and domestic demand support growth with potential in MEA, Europe, and Latin America.

items.title: L&T secures ₹5,000 - 10,000 crore order from SAIL, other clients in metals segment
items.summary:
- L&T secured a major EPC order worth ₹5,000-₹10,000 crore from SAIL and other Indian metals clients, including full EP installation for IISCO Steel Plant’s modernization (coke oven, by-product plant, basic oxygen furnace, and material handling).
- SAIL’s Bokaro expansion includes L&T setting up Sinter Plant No. 2 as part of upstream upgrades, while IISCO’s capacity rises from 2.5 to 6.5 MTPA.
- L&T also secured orders for material-handling equipment (stacker reclaimers, wagon tipplers) from other clients, underscoring its end-to-end execution capabilities.

items.title: L&T secures ₹5,000 - 10,000 crore order from SAIL, other clients in metals segment
items.summary:
- L&T's Minerals & Metals unit secured a major EPC order worth ₹5,000–₹10,000 crore from SAIL and other Indian clients for metals-sector projects.
- The scope includes engineering, procurement and installation for coke-oven battery, by-product plant, basic oxygen furnace and material-handling systems as part of SAIL's modernization to raise IISCO's capacity from 2.5 to 6.5 mtpa.
- L&T will also set up Sinter Plant No. 2 at Bokaro as part of upstream expansion, and has orders for material-handling equipment such as stacker reclaimers and wagon tipplers from other clients.

items.title: GST collections rise 6% to over ₹1.74 lakh cr in December 2025
items.summary:
- December 2025 GST gross revenue up 6.1% to ₹1,74,550 crore; net receipts after refunds ₹1,45,00 crore (↑2.2%); refunds up 31%; domestic revenue +1.2%, imports +19.7%. 
- From Sept 22, 2025, GST slabs to 5% and 18%, with a 40% ultra-luxury/demerit goods rate; compensation cess now only on tobacco; rate cuts muted revenue growth but volume rose. 
- State performance is uneven: ~17 states negative GST growth; Maharashtra, Gujarat, Karnataka and Haryana anchored revenues; first half FY26 still strong but tapering due to rate cuts.

items.title: Neuralink plans 'high-volume' brain implant production by 2026, Musk says
items.summary:
- Neuralink targets high-volume brain-implant production by 2026 after a $650 million funding round and plans automated surgery.
- Implants target spinal cord injury and similar conditions; the first patient has used them to play video games, browse the web, and move a cursor.
- Trials began in 2024; by September, 12 recipients with severe paralysis used implants to control digital and physical tools by thought.

items.title: Nuclear power play: NTPC, foreign companies ink pacts
items.summary:
- NTPC signed NDAs with Rosatom and EDF to study large PWR collaboration and inform tenders, with emphasis on indigenisation.
- NTPC invites EOIs for co-operation to indigenise PWR tech, scouts 30+ sites, and is weighing SMRs with Holtec amid private-sector liberalisation.
- NTPC targets ~30 GW by 2047 under the 100 GW nuclear roadmap via Parmanu Urja Nigam and ASHVINI with NPCIL.

items.title: Lowest steel prices in five years in India in 2025: Narendran
items.summary:
- India’s 2025 domestic steel prices fall to five-year lows amid strong demand; global disruptions and rising protectionism pressure prices, while China’s slowdown boosts exports.
- Tata Steel’s performance improves due to management–union collaboration; capex includes a Rs 2,000 crore Combi Mill at Jamshedpur, Tinplate investments, and capacity rises at Kalinganagar, Meramandali, and Neelachal, with Ludhiana starting in March.
- India remains a large, fast-growing steel market; Narendran calls for vigilance and readiness to face global headwinds.

items.title: Chip industry pushes back as govt plans market-linked DLI 2.0 sops
items.summary:
- DLI 2.0 replaces reimbursement with pari-passu funding, equal government-private investment, and removes the ₹15 crore cap, enabling larger projects.
- Industry wants upfront public funding without private matching; officials caution unconditional backing risks misuse and questions viability.
- Plan targets consumer electronics/networking chips with ~₹5,000 crore outlay and includes repayment if IP moves abroad.

items.title: NMDC iron ore output grows 15% in December, sales rise 19%
items.summary:
- In December 2025, NMDC produced 5.40 MT of iron ore, up 14.64% YoY from 4.71 MT in Dec 2024.
- December 2025 sales were 6.64 MT, up 18.67% YoY from 3.91 MT in Dec 2024.
- For Apr–Dec FY26, cumulative production reached 36.89 MT vs 30.77 MT in FY25; sales totaled 34.92 MT vs 31.80 MT in Apr–Dec FY25; NMDC remains India's largest iron ore miner, accounting for over 20% of demand.

items.title: Excise duty on tobacco: Manufacturers to install CCTV, preserve footage for 24 months from Feb 1
items.summary: - India hikes excise on chewing tobacco: 82% (chewing/jarda) and 91% (gutkha) from Feb 1, 2026, atop 40% GST. - Pouch-packers must install CCTV on packing lines and retain footage for 24 months; disclose machine specs and retail prices. - Capacity to be determined after factory inspection; abatement may apply for 15 days of non-operation; applies to pouches; tins taxed on value; notification issued Dec 31, 2025.

items.title: IREDA's loan disbursements up 44% at ₹24,903 cr in April-December
items.summary:
- IREDA's loan book rose to ₹87,975 crore by 31 December 2025, up 28% year-on-year.
- Disbursements for Apr–Dec 2025 totaled ₹24,903 crore, up 44% from ₹17,236 crore in the year-ago period; sanctions for the period stood at ₹40,100 crore, up 29%.
- CMD Pradip Kumar Das attributed the gains to growing confidence in IREDA's financing capabilities and momentum in the renewable energy sector, with the expanding loan book underpinning India's green-energy growth.

items.title: Air Marshal Narmdeshwar Tiwari retires as VCAS after four decades of service
items.summary: - Air Marshal Narmdeshwar Tiwari retired as VCAS on 31 Dec 2025 after four decades of service, with 3,600+ flying hours.\n- Commissioned 1986 (fighter); QFI and Experimental Test Pilot; led IAF Test Pilots’ School and the Defence Services Staff College; flight-tested LCA and operationalised the Litening Pod during the 1999 Kargil operations.\n- Held key posts including AOC-in-C SWAC, Deputy Chief of the Air Staff (Plans/Projects) and air attaché in Paris; PVSM 2025, AVSM 2022, VSM 2008; assumed the VCAS role on 2 May 2025.

items.title: KEC International Ltd. secures ₹1,050 crore orders across transmission, civil and renewables segments
items.summary:
- Orders worth ₹1,050 crore across transmission, civil, cables/conductors and renewables, including the first 100+ MW wind BoP project in southern India.
- SAE Towers reports sizable orders in Mexico; Transmission & Distribution wins across the Americas and cables/conductors orders in India and overseas.
- Civil Buildings & Factories secures a western India downstream project; YTD order intake about ₹19,300 crore; MD & CEO Vimal Kejriwal optimistic on growth.

items.title: Manufacturing plants of HPGIC to be upgraded: Industries minister
items.summary:
- Industries Minister Harshwardhan Chauhan directed HPGIC to reinvest profits to modernise its furniture plants to meet demand for modern/modular furniture in HP.
- At its 236th board meeting, the board approved a tender to procure new plant and machinery to upgrade furniture plants for rising public/private demand.
- CSR allocations include ₹1.38 crore to Police for 12 vehicles for the Anti-Chitta Campaign and ₹17.65 lakh for a new Government Primary School in Suniyadi, Shillai; draft balance sheet for FY 2024-25 approved.

items.title: Steel stocks in limelight; JSW Steel jumps nearly 5%
items.summary:
- Extension of a three-year safeguard duty on steel imports to Apr 2028 (from an initial 200-day, 12% levy) to curb dumping and protect domestic producers.
- JSW Steel leads the rally with ~5% gain; BSE metal index, Sensex and Nifty rise on hopes of improved pricing power.
- Analysts see the longer window as positive for profitability and market stability, with watchful eye on supply-demand dynamics.

items.title: DGCA seeks explanation from AI for operating Dreamliner despite snags
items.summary:
- DGCA issued a show-cause to Air India for operating Boeing 787-8 VT-ANI despite snags and MEL non-compliance on a June 28 flight.
- The regulator flags safety concerns around aircraft dispatch, MEL compliance and flight-crew decision-making on AI flights 258 and 357 between Delhi and Tokyo.
- Air India has not commented; it is unclear whether VT-ANI is still in service as of the Jan 1, 2026 update.

items.title: Nvidia sounds out TSMC on new H200 chip order as China demand jumps
items.summary:
- Nvidia asks TSMC to ramp up production for China; stock ~700k (incl ~100k GH200 modules); Chinese orders exceed 2 million for 2026; first shipments from existing stock before the Lunar New Year.
- H200 runs on TSMC 4nm; standalone H200s and eight-chip GH200 modules; eight-chip H200 module ~1.5M yuan (~$210k); per-chip ~$27k; volume discounts; grey-market modules ~1.75M yuan.
- Regulatory backdrop: Trump admin allowed H200 exports with a 25% fee; Biden-era bans reversed; China may bundle each H200 with domestic quota; ByteDance plans ~100B yuan Nvidia chip spend in 2026 if allowed; Nvidia says licensed China sales won't hit US supply; risk if China tightens controls.

items.title: Pascal Forrer takes charge as CEO of REGO-FIX
items.summary:
- Pascal Forrer will become CEO of REGO-FIX on January 1, 2026, under a long-term succession plan.
- Richard Weber will transition to Chairman and focus on strategic direction while remaining involved with the family-owned business.
- The board unanimously approved the plan and Forrer's leadership will be complemented by Weber's ongoing collaboration to align strategy and operations.

items.title: Energy efficiency star labelling made mandatory for more appliances from January 1
Auto PLI scheme on track to exceed ₹42,500 crore investment target: Govt
items.summary:
- Auto PLI scheme on track to surpass ₹42,500 crore target as manufacturers commit over ₹35,000 crore and 72 of 82 applicants have invested
- Eighteen firms met investment and 50% DVA thresholds; 5–10 more expected next year; bank guarantees may be invoked for remaining investments
- About ₹2,000 crore disbursed of ₹2,091 crore; scheme boosts localisation and EV manufacturing, benefiting MSMEs

items.title: India’s chip ambition takes flight with customers signing up
items.summary:
- India’s push is moving from policy to action as Tata Electronics signs manufacturing/assembly pacts with Intel and Rohm to produce in India.
- Apple and other global players are in talks to assemble and package components with Indian chip makers, with OSAT partnerships seen as a path to a domestic ecosystem.
- ISM validation is underway, with expected 2026 shop setups and a shift toward a mature, locally integrated supply chain driven by fabless players, auto and industrial electronics.

items.title: Delhi's rooftop solar push: Surya Ghar scheme, ₹17,000 cr upgrade to meet rising power demand
items.summary:
- Delhi aims to meet rising demand with rooftop solar expansion under Surya Ghar and a ₹17,000 crore three-year upgrade of transmission and distribution networks.
- The plan prioritizes rooftop solar on government buildings, wide household participation, and use of underutilized spaces like flyovers, with feasibility studies and constituency-level upgrades.
- Projected demand growth: current peak above 8,400 MW, rising to ~11,500–12,000 MW by 2030 and ~20,000 MW by 2040, with solar central to growth and reduced reliance on conventional power.

items.title: Centre pushes coal bed methane drive in unexplored areas
items.summary:
- India to accelerate CBM exploration in unexplored/abandoned coal areas, including de-coaled mines.
- CIL and subsidiaries seek leaseholds; Bharat Coking Coal Limited (BCCL) awards a CBM block in Jharkhand's Jharia.
- With ~92 tcf CBM across 12 states, policy support and tech investments aim to lift production from 2.27 to 5 MMSCMD by 2027-28 for energy security.

items.title: Pragati platform accelerates ₹85 lakh crore projects: PM Modi outlines 'reform, perform, transform' vision
items.summary:
- Modi said Pragati has accelerated projects worth over ₹85 lakh crore in the past decade, signaling governance transformation via reform, perform, transform.
- At the 50th Pragati meeting, five infrastructure projects (road, rail, power, water, coal) worth over ₹40,000 crore were reviewed, with PM SHRI schools proposed as a national outcome benchmark.
- Origin from Swagat in Gujarat: Pragati unites large projects and grievance redressal on one platform for review, resolution and follow-up.

items.title: Ministry in talks with states to give some drug cos more time for good manufacturing practices compliance
items.summary:
- Union health ministry may grant a six-month, case-by-case extension to implement revised Schedule M GMP norms for units that have submitted upgrade plans.
- Schedule M revisions (Dec 2023) tighten quality controls; deadlines: >₹250 crore turnover units from July 1, 2024; MSMEs by Jan 1, 2025, later to Dec 31, 2025.
- Industry warns hard deadlines could cause shortages and job losses; >60% of ~8,500 SMEs could shut without extension; stance depends on upgrade plans and state feedback.

items.title: Uttar Pradesh has emerged as a key hub for electronics manufacturing
items.summary:
- UP is emerging as a fast-growing electronics manufacturing hub with policy support, robust infra and clusters to attract investments.
- The Bharat Electronics Yatra and the 2026 electronica India/productronica editions in UP will boost demand-supply linkages, with 300+ exhibitors in Greater Noida.
- Stakeholders say platforms uniting government, industry and demand will strengthen regional clusters, domestic manufacturing and long-term electronics growth.

items.title: Delhi HC restrains manufacturer from infringing Britannia's 'Little Hearts' mark
items.summary:
- Delhi HC restrains Shri Swastik Organics from infringing Britannia's Little Hearts mark and 3D biscuit shape.
- Court found a prima facie case, irreparable harm, and directed delisting of infringing products on an e-commerce platform.
- Case listed for further hearing on May 21, 2026.

items.title: Government notifies first set of export promotion mission scheme
items.summary:
- MAS under the six-year Export Promotion Mission (EPM) with ₹4,531 crore for MAS within a ₹14,000 crore budget; total ₹25,060 crore EPM with reallocations possible.
- It targets MSMEs and first-time exporters, supporting participation in international fairs to ease trade finance and broaden global reach.
- An IEC-based exporter index will track performance over five years; cost-sharing starts at 60/40 (govt/private) and rises to 80% for priority sectors.

items.title: Govt extends safeguard duties on imports of steel products for 3 yrs to curb dumping
items.summary:
- India extends steel-import safeguards for three years, keeping a 12% duty in year 1 (Apr 2025–Apr 2026), 11.5% in year 2, and 11% in year 3.
- The DGTR probe followed a complaint by the Indian Steel Association on behalf of major producers to curb dumping and protect domestic capacity and supply.
- Market reaction saw gains in steel stocks; critics warn higher duties could raise raw material costs for users and MSMEs.

items.title: AI can turn blue-collar into gold: Anand Mahindra
items.summary: - AI is an accelerator that turns hands-on skills into premium assets as shop-floor workers partner with AI and data tools.\n- Mahindra’s skilling push—Young India Skills University, skill centers and Tech Mahindra academies—build high-tech proficiency with vocational mastery.\n- By 2025, focus on SUVs, farm equipment, electric three-wheelers and Mahindra Finance; AI-led mobility and a modern, future-ready brand.

items.title: Gen Z stands at the heart of India’s big manufacturing pivot
Rosatom supplies nuclear fuel to India for Kudankulam NPP’s Unit 3
items.summary: - Rosatom's Nuclear Fuel Division loaded the initial core for Kudankulam NPP Unit 3 under a full-lifetime fuel-supply contract for Units 3 and 4.\n- TVS-2M fuel has higher uranium mass, debris-filter improvements, and extends the fuel cycle to 18 months, cutting refueling outages.\n- Rosatom-India cooperation continues with ongoing fuel-cycle optimization and engineering services across the plant's life.

items.title: Partnr plans to nearly triple dark stores to 350–400 in two years
DRDO successfully conducts salvo launch of Pralay missile from Odisha coast
Factories don’t need more platforms, they need outcomes: Rockwell’s Dilip Sawhney on Industry 4.0
items.summary:
- Industry 4.0 fails when technology leads and context is missing; data must be actionable with thresholds, timing and impact to be trusted.
- Start with plant pain, deliver weeks-long wins in brownfield factories, and define data needs by solving a few business problems for managers.
- Build shop-floor oriented automation (AI/vision without line stoppages, predictive planning options) with measurement, cybersecurity and safety as core outcomes.

items.title: China's CXMT eyes $4.2 billion Shanghai listing to fund DRAM expansion
items.summary:
- CXMT aims to raise 29.5 billion yuan (~$4.2B) in a Shanghai IPO to fund DRAM capacity expansion and R&D. 
- Founded in 2016 with state backing, CXMT runs three 12-inch DRAM fabs in Beijing and Hefei, holding ~4% of global DRAM share in Q2, aiming to challenge Samsung, SK Hynix and Micron. 
- The company is pushing into high-bandwidth memory (HBM) with plans for HBM back-end packaging in Shanghai by end-2026, potentially profitable by 2026 depending on wafer supply and prices.

items.title: Premier Energies rakes in orders worth ₹2,307 crore in Q3 FY26
items.summary:
- Premier Energies secured new orders worth ₹2,307.30 crore in Q3 FY26 from domestic IPPs and Indian customers, with execution across FY27–FY28.
- Orders support capacity expansion to 10.6 GW solar cells and 11.1 GW solar modules by Sep 2026, improving revenue visibility.
- The company attributes the inflow to its manufacturing capabilities, technology roadmap, and backward integration within an integrated platform aligned with Atmanirbhar Bharat.

items.title: India imposes three-year tariff on some steel products to curb cheap imports
items.summary:
- India imposes a three-year safeguard duty on select steel imports to shield domestic producers from cheap, substandard steel.
- The duty rates are 12% in year 1, 11.5% in year 2, and 11% in year 3; applies to imports from China, Vietnam and Nepal; stainless steel and some specialty products are exempt.
- The measure follows a DGTR recommendation after a sharp rise in imports causing injury; a 200-day tariff preceded it amid broader global trade frictions.

items.title: Scale-up phase awaits semicon, EMS companies as Centre deepens play
items.summary:
- India’s ISM 2.0 shifts from MOUs to action, driving a scale-up phase with a broader focus beyond silicon fabs to display fabs, advanced packaging, and specialty chemicals, plus a larger outlay and predictable incentives.
- Domestic value-chain deepening with localisation of camera modules, batteries, displays, and PCBs, signaling a local components ecosystem; the ECMS scheme is a milestone for electronics manufacturing.
- 2026 outlook: the mobile phone PLI ends in March 2026, with expectations of ECMS outcomes, progress on semiconductor projects, and stronger integration of Indian manufacturing into global production and export networks.

items.title: TSMC says started mass production of 'most advanced' 2nm chips
China-based OmniVision Integrated Circuits seeks to raise up to $617 million in HK listing
items.summary:
- OmniVision Integrated Circuits plans to raise up to HK$4.80 billion via a Hong Kong IPO, offering 45.8 million H shares at up to HK$104.80 per share.
- Final offer price due by Jan 9; the float signals continued appetite for Chinese tech listings in HK amid regulatory changes and ample liquidity.
- 2025 HK IPOs average first-day gains around 40%; HKEX data show HK$285.8 billion raised from 119 listings as of Dec 30, with CATL and Mixue Group among notable listings.

items.title: China's GigaDevice Semiconductor looks to raise over $600 million in HK IPO
items.summary:
- GigaDevice Semiconductor plans to raise up to HK$4.68 billion ($601.47 million) in a Hong Kong IPO, per a Wednesday filing.
- The offering comprises 28.9 million H shares at up to HK$162.00 per share, as Chinese AI and chip firms tap HK's IPO window.
- Separately, AI startup MiniMax Group is targeting up to HK$4.19 billion in its own Hong Kong IPO, per a separate filing.

items.title: TRAI issues recommendations on use of foreign SIMs in export-focused IoT devices
Bharat Forge signs its largest small arms contract worth ₹1,662 cr with Defence Ministry
PM Modi meets economists, sector experts ahead of Union Budget 2026-27
India's cement industry to grow 6-7% in FY27, aided by housing and infra sector: ICRA
Defence Ministry signs ₹4,666 crore deals to buy new carbines and torpedoes
Bihar govt commissions 1st phase of ₹2,800 crore Kajra Solar Project
Need seamless coordination among ministries to bolster self-reliance in critical minerals: Parliamentary panel
